entityId.localType: State Library of New South Wales - Manuscripts & Pictures Call Number

biogHist.abstract: Infants' Home (Ashfield, N.S.W.) Records, 1874-1966 is a collection of records created by The Infants' Home between 1874 and 1966 and held by the State Library of New South Wales. This collection consists of minute books which describe the weekly events in the Home including information about applicants, children and their families, other records of residents, letterbooks, a visitors' book, the matron's diary, financial records, newscuttings and photographs.
biogHist.p: Access to the collection is restricted to former residents of The Infants' Home, Ashfield or members of their family. Permission to access the records must be given by The Infants' Home Ashfield, where proof of identity must be provided before information is supplied. Access to the original records is not permitted. For assistance accessing the records contact the State Library of New South Wales who can help you with the process.
The collection includes the following records:

list.item: Admissions and Discharges 1902-1910 contain information such as: name; age; date of admission; circumstances of parents; and reason for admission.

The Daily Record Of Children Admitted and Discharged (1959-1964) register records the names of children admitted to and discharged from the home, and the date and reason for admission and discharge. In some cases, details are given such as by whom admitted and to whom discharged. (1 volume)

The Lists Of Children In The Home (1947-1953) are very similar in content to admission books and contain information such as: name; age; date of admission; circumstances of parents; and reason for admission. (1 volume)

The Minute Books (1874-1965) of the Committee of the Home include monthly reports to the Committee by the Matron, with lists of the names of children admitted and discharged, and any children who have been ill or who have died. In the absence of other records, these are an important source of information about residents of the Home. (41 volumes)
Records Of Inmates (1875-1877; 1924-1929) contain information such as: name; age; date of admission; circumstances of parents; and reason for admission. (2 volumes)
Box Of Newscuttings And Miscellaneous 1877-1966; 5 Photographs ca.1890 (1 volume)
Diary Of The Matron Of Sydney Foundling Hospital 1875-1876 (1 volume)
